main

Class Layout

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Layout

  • public class Layout
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a Layout for the game, consisting of a borderPane with a GridPane in the centre, and a MenuHandler at the top. When you create the layout you need to pass in the difficulty of the game as an int[] to determine the amount of rows and columns to make for the grid

    • Method Detail

      • createGrid

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane createGrid(int col,
                                               int row)
        Creates a gridPane with the dimensions of length and height, and fills each grid section with a new Panel, and stores that panel in an array of panels.
        Parameters:
        col - amount of cols in the grid
        row - amount of rows in the grid
        Returns:
        the gridPane that was created

      • createMenu

        public MenuHandler createMenu(java.lang.String[][] menuItems)
        Creates a menuBar in the form of a MenuHandler
        Parameters:
        menuItems - the items in the menu as a 2D string array in the form {{main1, main2,...}, {main1Sub1, main1Sub2, ...}, {main2Sub1, main2Sub2, ...}, ...} with the string "sep" for a separator.
        Returns:
        the created MenuHandler with all the menus added
        See Also:
        MenuHandler

      • newGrid

        public void newGrid(int col,
                    int row)
        Creates a new grid overriding the old one. Used for resetting the grid for a new game
        Parameters:
        col - number of cols in new grid
        row - number of rows in new grid
